20101221020613.000|20101221020614.000|CC1|>>> POLICE HAVE IDENTIFIED 21

20101221020616.000|20101221020618.000|CC1|SUSPECT IN THE SO-CALLED GRIM   
20101221020618.000|20101221020619.000|CC1|SLEEPER CASE.                   
20101221020619.000|20101221020621.000|CC1|STILL MORE THAN 120 PHOTOS OF   
20101221020621.000|20101221020623.000|CC1|WOMEN WHO HAVE NOT BEEN         
20101221020623.000|20101221020623.000|CC1|IDENTIFIED.                     
20101221020623.000|20101221020626.000|CC1|OVER THE WEEKEND, LAPD WEBSITE  
20101221020626.000|20101221020629.000|CC1|HAD MORE THAN 11 MILLION HITS.  
20101221020629.000|20101221020634.000|CC1|DETECTIVES FOUND THE PHOTOS WHEN
20101221020634.000|20101221020635.000|CC1|SEARCHING THE HOME OF LONNY

20101221021548.000|20101221021550.000|CC1|TO EXPLAIN.                     
20101221021550.000|20101221021550.000|CC1|PATRICK.                        
20101221021550.000|20101221021553.000|CC1|>> WELL, ANNA, WHAT WE HAVE IS  
20101221021553.000|20101221021554.000|CC1|RAIN THAT'S NEARLY AS CONTINUOUS
20101221021554.000|20101221021555.000|CC1|AS THE FLOW OF A RIVER.         
20101221021555.000|20101221021557.000|CC1|AND IF IT FEELS LIKE THERE IS A 
20101221021557.000|20101221021559.000|CC1|RIVER IN THE SKY DELIVERING ALL 
20101221021559.000|20101221021601.000|CC1|OF THIS MOISTURE, SCIENTISTS SAY
20101221021601.000|20101221021603.000|CC1|YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY RIGHT.       
20101221021603.000|20101221021605.000|CC1|IT'S CALLED AN ATMOSPHERIC      
20101221021605.000|20101221021606.000|CC1|RIVER.                          
20101221021606.000|20101221021607.000|CC1|IT DEVELOPS PERIODICALLY AND WE 
20101221021607.000|20101221021608.000|CC1|KNOW FROM HISTORY, THAT A BIG   
20101221021608.000|20101221021615.000|CC1|ONE CAN LAST AS LONG AS 45 DAYS.

20101221021617.000|20101221021617.000|CC1|STOP.                           
20101221021617.000|20101221021618.000|CC1|FILLING STREAMS AND RIVERS AS

20101221021626.000|20101221021627.000|CC1|YOU CAN SEE IT IN A SATELLITE   
20101221021627.000|20101221021629.000|CC1|IMAGE AS THAT ARC OF CLOUDINESS.
20101221021629.000|20101221021632.000|CC1|THIS IS THE SOUTHLAND'S BIGGEST 
20101221021632.000|20101221021633.000|CC1|ATMOSPHERIC RIVER IN AT LEAST A 
20101221021633.000|20101221021635.000|CC1|DECADE, AND IT'S STILL NOT OVER.
20101221021635.000|20101221021636.000|CC1|>> THE ATMOSPHERIC RIVER BRINGS 
20101221021636.000|20101221021638.000|CC1|IN THE MOISTURE.                
20101221021638.000|20101221021639.000|CC1|HOW MUCH RAIN GETS DROPPED OUT

20101221021640.000|20101221021643.000|CC1|JUST LIKE EARTHQUAKES.          
20101221021643.000|20101221021645.000|CC1|>> Reporter: FORGIVE THE        
20101221021645.000|20101221021647.000|CC1|EARTHQUAKE ANALOGY.             
20101221021647.000|20101221021648.000|CC1|QUAKES HAVE LONG BEEN HER FOCUS.
20101221021648.000|20101221021650.000|CC1|PREPARING A SCENARIO FOR THE    
20101221021650.000|20101221021654.000|CC1|NEXT BIG ONE, LAST FELT IN 1857.
20101221021654.000|20101221021655.000|CC1|FOUR YEARS LATER, AFTER IT      
20101221021655.000|20101221021656.000|CC1|STARTED RAINING, SOMETHING EVEN 
20101221021656.000|20101221021658.000|CC1|MORE DESTRUCTIONIVE HAPPENED.   
20101221021658.000|20101221021703.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THE WINTER OF      
20101221021703.000|20101221021705.000|CC1|1861-62, IT RAINED 45 DAYS      
20101221021705.000|20101221021706.000|CC1|STRAIGHT IN CALIFORNIA AND IT   
20101221021706.000|20101221021708.000|CC1|WAS SAID TO BE FLOODED FROM     
20101221021708.000|20101221021711.000|CC1|MOUNTAIN TO MOUNTAIN.           
20101221021711.000|20101221021714.000|CC1|>> Reporter: EVOCATIVE OF THE   
20101221021714.000|20101221021719.000|CC1|BIBLICAL NOAH AND ITS ARC.      
20101221021719.000|20101221021721.000|CC1|ARC STORM IS WHAT IT'S BEEN     
20101221021721.000|20101221021721.000|CC1|CALLED.                         
20101221021721.000|20101221021723.000|CC1|>> IT LITERALLY CHANGED         
20101221021723.000|20101221021724.000|CC1|CALIFORNIA.                     
20101221021724.000|20101221021725.000|CC1|IT BANKRUPTED THE STATE.        
20101221021725.000|20101221021728.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SINCE THEN, WE'VE  
20101221021728.000|20101221021730.000|CC1|HAD DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FROM     
20101221021730.000|20101221021734.000|CC1|ATMOSPHEIC RIVERS THAT KEPT     
20101221021734.000|20101221021736.000|CC1|FLOWING LONGER THAN A WEEK.     
20101221021736.000|20101221021739.000|CC1|HOW DESTRUCTIVE WOULD THAT BE IN
20101221021739.000|20101221021739.000|CC1|PRESENT-DAY CALIFORNIA?         
20101221021739.000|20101221021741.000|CC1|>> WE MADE A MODEL OF THIS TYPE
